availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John W. McWhorter (Adair County, Kentucky, farm laborer.)

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky, farm laborer. Kentucky native. Son of Richard Woodrem McWhorter and Elizabeth M. Sutherland McWhorter. Married to Minerva Catherine Vendeever McWhorter in Casey County on March 3, 1853. Father of Josephine McWhorter Fields, William McWhorter, Richard McWhorter, Hugh L. McWhorter, and Tobias McWhorter. Farm laborer in Adair County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Adair County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Division 2, p. 96B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Division 2, p. 74.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 2, p. 6.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Illinois, Fulton County, Isabel, p. 84A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Casey County Marriages, Film #000591587, p. 149.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994027, X County Births/Marriages/Deaths, p. 191.
Texas Death Certificates, 1903-1982, Bureau of Vital Statistics, Department of State Health Services, Austin, TX, File #20433.
